doc.after: Volkswagen was originally created in 1937 by the German Labour Front (Deutsche Arbeitsfront).[2] In the early 1930s, the German auto industry was still largely composed of luxury models, and the average German could rarely afford anything more than a motorcycle. As a result, only one German out of 50 owned a car. Seeking a potential new market, some car makers began independent "peoples' car" projectsÂ â Mercedes' 170H, Adler's AutoBahn, Steyr 55, Hanomag 1.3L, among others.
